name: Cook the Book: Braised 'Red Cooked' Wings, Shanghai-Style
description: "Red cooking" sounds like an accusation Joseph McCarthy might have made, but is really a technique of slow-braising in dark soy sauce that imparts a deep, glossy red to whatever's in the pot. Calling for two cups of red wine,...

recipeInstructions.text: Cut off the wing tips and save them for making stock. Cut the wings in half through the joint. In a large bowl, combine all the remaining ingredients.

Place a deep 12-inch pan over medium heat. Add the red wine mixture and bring to a simmer. Add the chicken wings. Bring to a low boil, cover, turn the heat to low, and simmer until the wings become very tender, about 30 minutes. Stir occasionally. This can be done 24 hours prior to serving.
To serve, bring the wings and sauce to a low boil. Cook until nearly all the sauce evaporates and forms a glaze around the wings. Serve.
